title: Prompt Engineering Optimization: Synchronize Documentation with Code Changes
description: Implement systematic process for keeping instruction files and documentation synchronized with code changes to prevent AI agents from applying outdated practices. Based on lessons learned from development process reflection (devlog #228), this addresses the 15% of bugs caused by module resolution and import pattern inconsistencies.

notes.content: Starting prompt engineering optimization by auditing current instruction files and identifying gaps with current code patterns.

Identified key gaps in instruction files:

1. **Missing .js extensions**: Some files still use imports without .js extensions
2. **Workspace architecture**: No guidance on WorkspaceDevlogManager vs DevlogManager  
3. **ESM patterns**: Need clearer guidance on when type-only imports can omit .js
4. **Barrel exports**: Some files import from '../types' instead of '../types/index.js'

Starting with updating the core instruction file first.

context.businessContext: Poor synchronization between code patterns and documentation leads to AI agents applying outdated practices, causing recurring bugs and development inefficiency. This directly impacts developer productivity and code quality.
context.technicalContext: Analysis of recent bugfixes shows that code patterns evolved (ESM imports, workspace architecture) but instruction files lagged behind. AI agents need up-to-date guidance to avoid repeating resolved issues.
